Lissauer's tract of spinal cord.MyeloDefiningCriteria: Stains more lightly than adjacent spinal cord tracts due to the large number of finely myelinated and unmyelinated fibers in this tract
Lissauer's tract of spinal cord.EditorialNote: Neuronames uses the name "dorsolateral fasciculus" as the preferred name.  However, Nolte recommends that Lissauer's tract be used (Nolte, The Human Brain, 6th ed, page 235 footnote)
Lissauer's tract of spinal cord.Definition: White matter tract in spinal cord laying between the substantia gelatinosa and the surface of the spinal cord.
